key_points: More than half a million people disappear each year, per the U.S. Department of Justice.
Missing White Woman Syndrome highlights the disparity in media attention towards missing people of different races.
Gabby Petito's disappearance and the internet's reaction exemplified Missing White Woman Syndrome.
A study found 710 indigenous people were reported missing in Wyoming within a year, spotlighting racial disparities.
Samuel Olson's case involved his tragic death; his father's girlfriend was charged with murder.
Maya Millete vanished amidst plans to divorce her husband, who was later charged with her murder.
Daniel Robinson's disappearance in Arizona highlighted by his father's activism amidst comparisons to Petito's case.
Gabby Petito's case drew massive media attention; her death ruled a homicide by strangulation.
Josh Hall died from hypothermia or exposure; his dog found weeks after he went missing.
Elijah Lewis was found dead from violence, neglect, and fentanyl intoxication; his mother and her boyfriend charged.
